channel.title: Tag: mobile - blog.lmorchard.com
channel.description: It's all spinning wheels & self-doubt until the first pot of coffee.

item.title: Adding Android to a multi-platform React app
Experimenting with a multi-platform app using React
item.description: TL;DR: I built a toy app using React for web and native to get a feel for whether this hybrid approach is worth using. I think the answer is "yes" - but mainly for apps whose business logic & data models are more complex than their views.

item.title: Random thoughts for 2014 Oct 27
item.description: TL;DR: More random stuff collected and updated throughout the day.

item.title: My experience in becoming a FirefoxOS contributor
item.description: Back in September, I wrote that I wasn’t leaving MDN. And, I’m not, really. But, it turns out that FirefoxOS needs some help to reach its first release milestones. So, some of us webdevs from around Mozilla are temporarily switching our daily efforts over to slay bugs on Gaia. That’s the layer of FirefoxOS which provides the overall system UI and core apps.

item.title: In praise of dumb pipes – or, ISPs: please don’t get smart with me!
item.description: Something I’m having trouble finding these days is a dumb pipe. I just want a dumb pipe to the internet going to my house, and to the computer in my pocket. Let me give you money for bandwidth, and then butt out.

item.title: the iphone will not be your new mobile computer
